overview: Students will further develop a thorough musical background to cope with all stylistic demands of their instrument or voice and establish a sizeable repertoire covering all styles. Students will also further develop a thorough understanding of the applied approaches to the instrumental pedagogy of their instrument or voice.
DeliveryThis subject is co-delivered with MUSI90147 Performing to Teach 1, and MUSI90157 Pedagogue Recital.

assessments.description: 30-minute Practical Exam of an approved program of works 80% (100 hours of work required); and a Reflective Journal and Program with annotations – 20% (1000 words equivalent). 125 hours (of work required)
Hurdle requirement:. 100% attendance is expected, less than 80% will result in a fail in the subject.

Semester 1.Contact hours: Eight 1-hour individual lessons and four hours of group lessons; weekly 120-minute concert class; instrument class as arranged.

Semester 2.Contact hours: Eight 1-hour individual lessons and four hours of group lessons; weekly 120-minute concert class; instrument class as arranged.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.

Related Handbook entries: This subject contributes to the following:
Available to Study Abroad and/or Study E: This subject is available to students studying at the University from eligible overseas institutions on exchange and study abroad. Students are required to satisfy any listed requirements, such as pre- and co-requisites, for enrolment in the subject.
